properties.media:imagetext:
Chungking is a city of over one million people. It is built
on a steep hill and the streets are nothing but steps. We arrived at
the airport at which I am now writing on a typewritter of the air-
advisor to General Liu a Frenchman, and went up to Chungking from here
on a boat which belongs to the Standard Oil Co. We called on Admiral
Ho who has charge of the "Battleships" belonging to the Warlord and
then crossed the river to the section where all of the foreign resid-
ents live ( the foreign colony numbers about 30) There is no hotel at
Chungking. Our people always stay with the representative of the Stan-
dard Oil Co., but Mr. Chapelain and I went to the Postal Commissioners
house for the night. He is a Dane. He arranged for a chair for me and
told me just where to catch it, but by the time I got back across the
river it was almost dark. My chair was waiting for me. I got in and
the carriers started alon a narrow path up the mountain side. The
slope and hight was about the same as Shelving rod. At times we went
along the edge of cliffs where the slightest slip would have meant
disaster. It was a new experience which is now after three days quite
the common thing
to do but that first trip will remain with me for a
H--- of a long time. The house to which I was taken is a most facin-
ating place built in the Chinese style surrounded by a beautiful gar-
den .
The inside was full of reallyfine things collected during the ter
twenty odd years of residence in China of two very nice and tremend-
ously interesting people Mr.and Mrs. Holm. They had a dinner party for
Mr. Chapelain and me that night. I was the only American present. There
were three Frenchmen, one Swiss, one English, two Germans, one Dutchman
one Chinese, one Russian and one Italian. They all spoke nothing but
English which was something of a break for me.
The next night Monday
I spent with the Standard Oil man and his wife. Coming down the next
morning (it takes an hour to walk or be carried up to his place) we
walked right by an opium den and stopped at the door to take a 100k.
